body:
I hate this kind of wording.  It's not banning transgender FEMALES, it's banning males who pretend to be women/girls from playing on teams for females.  Females pretending to be men/boys can still play on female teams as long as they aren't juicing. 

Words mean things.  Stupid journalists.

I hate this kind of wording. It's not banning transgender FEMALES, it's banning males who pretend to be women/girls from playing on teams for females. Females pretending to be men/boys can still play on female teams as long as they aren't juicing.

Words mean things. Stupid journalists.

author.bio_html:
Goodbye. https://ruqqus.com/+The_Cabal/post/d9y9/i-told-you-so-all-the

Remember: History repeats, and the unaware are doomed to repeat it.

body:
The danger of hormone blockers is more physical and social than mental. Delaying puberty will cause someone to fall behind their peers and not be accustomed to the new setting. It will also mess up their natural processes whenever they are resumed and probably destroy their ability to have sex. Generally it's just too unsafe to "play god" and mess with something that alters the body so much when we know so little about it.

But as far as intelligence goes, children are actually far more intelligent than adults if you adjust for maturity. That doesn't mean they're superior, just that they're better at different things. Young brains are designed to absorb as much as possible as quickly as possible like a sponge. They have good imaginations, good problem-solving skills, generally more natural talents, and can learn things much more quickly. Puberty causes the entire brain to get rewired to be best at reproduction instead of the former function, especially for men (this is why non-autistic people can't remember almost anything about their childhood, because the pre and post puberty brain of the same person are basically the ship of Theseus). Of course adults do end up being smarter overall, but only because they're more experienced; if the brain kept growing the same way as it did in childhood into adulthood you'd be a savant. Most of the learning you'll do as an adult is just imitating and going through the motions until you can appear as though really understand something; but children usually learn in innovative ways and can truly understand new concepts.
body_html:
The danger of hormone blockers is more physical and social than mental. Delaying puberty will cause someone to fall behind their peers and not be accustomed to the new setting. It will also mess up their natural processes whenever they are resumed and probably destroy their ability to have sex. Generally it's just too unsafe to "play god" and mess with something that alters the body so much when we know so little about it.

But as far as intelligence goes, children are actually far more intelligent than adults if you adjust for maturity. That doesn't mean they're superior, just that they're better at different things. Young brains are designed to absorb as much as possible as quickly as possible like a sponge. They have good imaginations, good problem-solving skills, generally more natural talents, and can learn things much more quickly. Puberty causes the entire brain to get rewired to be best at reproduction instead of the former function, especially for men (this is why non-autistic people can't remember almost anything about their childhood, because the pre and post puberty brain of the same person are basically the ship of Theseus). Of course adults do end up being smarter overall, but only because they're more experienced; if the brain kept growing the same way as it did in childhood into adulthood you'd be a savant. Most of the learning you'll do as an adult is just imitating and going through the motions until you can appear as though really understand something; but children usually learn in innovative ways and can truly understand new concepts.

body: Every male on the planet was female at one time. Like I said every fetus begins as a female and males result from the effects of testosterone on the body. Males also have scars where the female parts would've been. There is even a syndrome where someone doesn't respond to hormones properly so they grow up female despite having XY chromosomes.
body_html: Every male on the planet was female at one time. Like I said every fetus begins as a female and males result from the effects of testosterone on the body. Males also have scars where the female parts would've been. There is even a syndrome where someone doesn't respond to hormones properly so they grow up female despite having XY chromosomes.

body: You're right, I had it backwards. Dimorphism is about the secondary sex characteristics, which isn't what defines sex. The reproductive abilities are. Which are fixed at birth (before that, obviously) and no amount of medical alterations can change that. Regardless of your support for transgender people, there is zero validity to the idea that anyone can change their sex. They can only fake it with medical intervention, clothes, wigs, makeup, etc... Their genetics are fixed, and the reproductive capabilities are fixed.

body: If that were the case males would not exist. Most of the coverage on trans people focuses on MtFs in which case you are 100% correct even though pop science won't admit it. However a female body really can mostly become male with some intervention, even though they won't be fertile (if they must be fertile then people with other complications must be considered intersex even if they clearly have one part or the other). This is just the biology behind it, male=modified female. I'm not sure why the hell anyone would actually *want* to do that though seeing how privileged women have it these days.

body:
>if they must be fertile then people with other complications must be considered intersex even if they clearly have one part or the other)

They don't need to be fertile, it's about reproductive capabilities. A female has zero chance at male reproductive capabilities. We can agree to disagree on this though.

As far as why any woman would want to transition to being man makes zero sense to me either. Their lives have to absolutely suck being that they would be the absolute bottom of the barrel in terms of masculinity, size and attractiveness. And they lose everything that is systemically in support of women. So it's like the worst of both worlds. Trans identifying males, on the other hand, get to have the biological advantage of being a male and the societal advantage of being a female. A straight white male is the absolute lowest status in the west, and he immediately becomes the highest social status (in terms of the SJW hierarchy) by just dressing slightly differently. No wonder we have so many trans identifying males.

if they must be fertile then people with other complications must be considered intersex even if they clearly have one part or the other)

No wonder we have so many trans identifying males.

body:
> Too old and the media has too large of an anti-trump playbook.   

Exactly.  

Even if you think Trump is *the right man for the job* -- rather than just the better of the two candidates we're stuck with -- the Left has his number.  And they can lazily parrot the same talking points used against him.  

Trump won in 2016 in part due to surprise: the media and Left in general didn't take him seriously until far too late.  

The element of surprise has been lost.  

Couple with that the fact that the American public, by and large, are sick of *hearing* about Trump.  That may not be Trump's fault entirely, but they don't want to be bombarded *again* with four years of "Orange Man Bad" on almost every front.    

It is time for somebody new.  If he gets Trump's seal of approval, great.  But Trump running again merely plays into the Left's hands.
body_html:
Too old and the media has too large of an anti-trump playbook.

Exactly.

Even if you think Trump is the right man for the job -- rather than just the better of the two candidates we're stuck with -- the Left has his number. And they can lazily parrot the same talking points used against him.

Trump won in 2016 in part due to surprise: the media and Left in general didn't take him seriously until far too late.

The element of surprise has been lost.

Couple with that the fact that the American public, by and large, are sick of hearing about Trump. That may not be Trump's fault entirely, but they don't want to be bombarded again with four years of "Orange Man Bad" on almost every front.

It is time for somebody new. If he gets Trump's seal of approval, great. But Trump running again merely plays into the Left's hands.

body: Believe it or not FtM is more common. It's amazing how much the media determines your perception isn't it? But anyway there's not any biological advantage to being male except physical strength and not having to deal with as many sexual organs. Males are less creative, more hormonal, die easier, feel worse pain despite having to endure more, less intelligent, can't multitask, have to change more radically during puberty, are hardwired to be angry, can't ever relax and have fun and always have to be competing about something, have less natural protection mechanisms against mental health problems, basically we're work machines hardwired to constantly be miserable. This serves a very practical purpose: it makes us better at protecting the female. Yep, that's it. Every part of our body and mind is designed for the female's benefit, we're just worthless meat to nature. That's not even getting started on the harsh social treatment of males which is also rooted in biology. Women suffering? Everyone help, this is so wrong! Man suffering? Ahh who cares. And as a reward, the men have to do all the work while the women get showered with gifts! Women can get anything they want by crying, and men have to fix every little discomfort of theirs, but men are evil jerks if they open up about even one problem. Even sex itself is merely bliss for the woman but a relief of tension and discomfort for the male. Men got jealous and conquered women for a few thousand years but other than that we have the rough end of the deal. And yet we *still* scream "women are the ones who are oppressed!".

body:
> media has too large of an anti-[insert any non dem] playbook. 

The media will churn whatever bs they can stick to you, and it doesn't matter how many times they get caught lying since no one's punishing them for violating ethics. And For one thing trump was relatively a benign and even relatively liked figure in the establishment before he ran president as a rep. 

Trump's biggest enemy is still technically himself and twitter. And with twatter gone that's one less ammo for the fake news to use against him
body_html:
media has too large of an anti-[insert any non dem] playbook.

The media will churn whatever bs they can stick to you, and it doesn't matter how many times they get caught lying since no one's punishing them for violating ethics. And For one thing trump was relatively a benign and even relatively liked figure in the establishment before he ran president as a rep.

Trump's biggest enemy is still technically himself and twitter. And with twatter gone that's one less ammo for the fake news to use against him

parent.body:
> Too old and the media has too large of an anti-trump playbook.   

Exactly.  

Even if you think Trump is *the right man for the job* -- rather than just the better of the two candidates we're stuck with -- the Left has his number.  And they can lazily parrot the same talking points used against him.  

Trump won in 2016 in part due to surprise: the media and Left in general didn't take him seriously until far too late.  

The element of surprise has been lost.  

Couple with that the fact that the American public, by and large, are sick of *hearing* about Trump.  That may not be Trump's fault entirely, but they don't want to be bombarded *again* with four years of "Orange Man Bad" on almost every front.    

It is time for somebody new.  If he gets Trump's seal of approval, great.  But Trump running again merely plays into the Left's hands.
parent.body_html:
Too old and the media has too large of an anti-trump playbook.

Exactly.

Even if you think Trump is the right man for the job -- rather than just the better of the two candidates we're stuck with -- the Left has his number. And they can lazily parrot the same talking points used against him.

Trump won in 2016 in part due to surprise: the media and Left in general didn't take him seriously until far too late.

The element of surprise has been lost.

Couple with that the fact that the American public, by and large, are sick of hearing about Trump. That may not be Trump's fault entirely, but they don't want to be bombarded again with four years of "Orange Man Bad" on almost every front.

It is time for somebody new. If he gets Trump's seal of approval, great. But Trump running again merely plays into the Left's hands.
